location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter General No. 185 of 1856 from Commander James Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Richard W Stevens, HM Consul at Tehran

mods.abstract: The letter concerns the recovery of a property (possibly located in Bushire) by a 'British protégé'. It references applications made to Hajee Abdul Mahamed, Malik Ool Tajar and the Dureya Beggee, Governor of Bushire. It is mentioned that there is an issue with the 'British protégé' being absent, which is causing delays; the Resident suggests that the Consul calls on the subject in question to appoint a private agent to act on his behalf.
